text:
Your OTHER Coexist Coffee that‚Äôs of a different class and vibe.

Unlike the one in the East, this Coexist coffee cafe is just a surprise. It‚Äôs situated at the rooftop of an industrial building with VERY limited parking around the building. If you fear parallel parking, park somewhere else and head over, your life would be better.

Food is excellent with a special twist. I took the Thai Toast something and the Laksa Fish and Chips. Both has that tangy sour taste with a nice delicious touch. Seatings are limited but they have that outdoor option which was not available when I arrived. It was a warm day.

Drinks were decent and coffee was sufficiently strong.

If you are lost, find the passenger lift with the dance pole and take it up to 7th storey then look for signs to Coexist, you won‚Äôt miss it.

Had this place on my radar for a while and finally made the trip down. It‚Äôs tucked away in a pretty ulu spot, and you‚Äôll need to hike up a short flight of stairs to reach this ‚Äúhidden‚Äù rooftop cafe‚Äîbut the views and food are totally worth it! I was pleasantly surprised that such a small, cosy space could serve up such quality coffee and well-curated dishes. Definitely worth checking out if you‚Äôre in the area.

Food was very good and amazing! Strongly recommend the truffle fries! Can feed 3 ppl and all 3 will feel full! Haha! Quiet and peaceful environment with music and few ppl. LOVE the matcha üçµ, so nice!!

Stumbled upon this charming cafe for an early breakfast and I was really impressed by the design. The outdoor rooftop area is a great spot to sit and enjoy the morning. The coffee was absolutely amazing‚Äîso much so that I ended up ordering 3 cups! The breakfast was also really good, though it can be a little pricey, but totally worth it for the quality.

If you‚Äôre living near Hillview and looking for a chill breakfast spot, this place is definitely a must-try. The vibe is relaxed and the food is top-notch.

A chic cafe located in one of the industrial buildings. You had to take the lift up to Level 7 and climb up a flight of stairs to get to the cafe.

Great coffee and even better food. Had the chilli crab shakshuka and Thai crabby toastie, and both were amazing. Very strong flavors and the portion size is good. 10/10 will come back!
